document.title: WISCONSIN ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

7E14C2F5D3334449B5D3D888214609FD.description:
With guidance and support during
shared writing, identify the letters
that represent sounds needed to
spell words.

6E6C761BF24E4F7E98E6D5212CBC20FB.description:
With guidance and support, use
letters to create words.

2E9BCC3F99DA4E1C9ADD878982F13ED0.description:
With guidance and support during
shared writing, put a period at the
end of a sentence.

B3CE8E164C2744BAAD214317515D50AE.description:
With guidance and support,
capitalize own name.

5EF984DCE4884B7CB946E63962648DD5.description:
Demonstrate emerging
understanding of conventions of
standardized English.

F38FD73885CB48929CCDDC8BCA76FD05.description:
With guidance and support, use
simple question words
(interrogatives)(e.g., who, what).

57C0DE48E42440D099FA1DABDCDEF5C8.description:
With guidance and support, use
common prepositions (e.g., on, off,
in, out).

FEADDC9A60E945DD8844DEE28DB16024.description:
With guidance and support, use
familiar frequently occurring
adjectives (e.g., big, hot).

A5BE3E28C096477499741106E76CF336.description:
With guidance and support, use
familiar personal pronouns (e.g., I,
me, and you).

3E459DE5BE84413590D7CD2C066ABA58.description:
Use frequently occurring plural
nouns in communication.

532E4973B8534A30A81C990B89174D35.description:
Use frequently occurring nouns in
communication.

EFB7307E848A4FCCB5E1624F92DA4861.description:
Demonstrate emerging
understanding of letter and word use.

C08535F5233D4C8080406200A035C9A4.description:
With guidance and support, use
words acquired through conversations,
being read to, and during shared reading
activities.

C43BDF8B605D4F28BEA05613BFB5A72F.description:
With guidance and support,
demonstrate understanding of
common verbs.

C7DF85517DB141FA87CEA2D7FE0A2FF4.description:
With guidance and support, sort
common objects into familiar
categories.

2CC7C97DB42E4435B62B344B719FE45D.description:
With guidance and support, identify
words about feelings.

ACAAC53983B24DDE8B1BEEFBAF579995.description:
Demonstrate emerging
understanding of word relationships.

915D12664AFC44D5A2949350C669E83B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
words used in every day routines.

D354C77B7D4E4AB0A12A710774594697.description:
Demonstrate emerging knowledge
of word meanings.

8517D5C0FC4A462A818302E6193ACF59.description:
Use language to achieve desired
outcomes when communicating.

9EC73B1AFAAD4269B6902ACB6797B9C0.description:
Add or select drawings or other
visual or tactile displays that relate to
familiar people, places, things, and events.

3C1DC9DC21A340E3A9D94D073D5450B0.description:
Identify familiar people, places,
things, and events.

80FB904FB077460DB3FFB1F3121205DE.description:
Communicate confusion or lack of
understanding ("I don't know.").

4A49BC601B5643F795D5CDF17463855F.description:
During shared reading activities,
answer questions about details presented
orally or through other media.

1707CFE11D764FC08D5F70E408E26910.description:
Consider individual differences
when communicating with others.

361F5A6CFA09453CA6CD64F8631C6C6F.description:
Use one or two words to ask
questions related to the topic or
text.

44701B69CDA9448B88447FAA3A396265.description:
Build on comments or topics
initiated by an adult.

CB0726F9A7E14482A47116BCB8BDA6E7.description:
Engage in multiple-turn-exchanges
with supportive adults.

DD9D2F4EFCDF433AB7CC76861AAA4F86.description:
With guidance and support,
participate in conversations with adults.

F390B1ACF59D40EDB2ACB5F8BF66E390.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, recall key details from literary or
informational texts.

18C32BE953D542FE9B10AA7BD201BCF6.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, identify information related to
personal experiences and answer simple
questions about those experiences.

F3E6924DD2BD4E2D86A2BD3B40827950.description:
With guidance and support,
participate in shared inquiry and writing
projects.

CDE2C76A1A1C41A9A0E9D59A5915028A.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, explore a variety of digital tools to
produce individual or group writing. With
guidance and support from adults, produce
writing through printing (including letter like marks or forming some printed letters).

A068879BCF9741F7908213F5BF01564A.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, add more information to their
own drawing, dictation, or writing on a topic
to strengthen it.

0C88C883AA94468FB9B309DBCBBA2F33.description:
With guidance and support, use
a combination of drawing, dictating and
writing to create a text that uses words
familiar to the student.

FC91CF06CC9F4AFEBC83FA98CA808E8B.description:
Convey events, real or imagined
and narrate a single event or
several loosely linked events.

DEEE28BFA3224D9287863C0BEB0F1D62.description:
Informative/Explanatory text in
which they provide some
information about a predetermined
or self chosen topic.

DE3B76DBED6B4C7498BF11C5D7C5D34F.description:
Opinion pieces in which they state
an opinion.

9F484E57862C4203BD17D7FFD40016E2.description:
With guidance and support, use
writing, dictation and/or drawing to
compose:

7E7DFC32D3584F92AC766F68CA9C5D9A.description:
With guidance and support, use
drawing, dictating, or writing to compose
writing for a variety of high-stakes and low stakes purposes.

70D27FB9988D47D291536EEF48F1084E.description:
With guidance and support,
compare parts of two texts, identifying
adventures or experiences of characters in a
text as same or different. (RI&RL)

7E2BCC802B524A83BD87FF5021843F20.description:
Identify points the author makes
in familiar text. (RI)

E3248B7CB29B44BB9F54DB9FD325DC9D.description:
Identify illustrations or
objects/tactile information that go with the
text.(RI&RL)

A20514D1FB614D8A9D85C90755542746.description:
Distinguish between words and
illustrations/graphics in a text. (RI&RL)

EFC5B3F42B194523A57B0EAE5CC9FFF8.description:
With guidance and support,
identify a text as telling a story or teaching
facts (i.e., informational) and locate the front
cover, back cover, and title page of the
text. (RI&RL)

0869F4FE55364579888A9F419005209E.description:
With guidance and support,
identify sensory or feeling words in a
familiar text; ask the reader to explain the
meaning of unknown words. (RI&RL)

44BF655C5D744C37B98CEDDD18AAC3A5.description:
Identify characters and settings
(RL) or important details and events (RI) in
familiar texts.

ADE1C52F70BB4D298F1727F69361F2C5.description:
With guidance and support,
identify important details (RI) and recount
major events (RL) in familiar texts.

1D238751E5A5440DA4D3F5384262C0FE.description:
Participate in shared reading of a
variety of reading materials
reflecting a variety of text genres.

1DD3B3611F9A473D810FCCD58C596F67.description:
Engage in sustained, independent
study of books.

0C72FEE032A14634BC44DC731F6B22F4.description: Begin to attend to words in print.

D9D25BD6EAF44369B12D1BCDD7754251.description:
With guidance and support,
recognize familiar words that are
used in everyday routines.

9C7AB827FAA44D5B9F1542F665DDC470.description:
Recognize and/or identify upper
case letters of the alphabet.

E75EBF398B6745D7B6121DE06B71DDC0.description:
Demonstrate emerging letter and
word identification skills.

5AAEF6F72D3B42668BC14972FF8BC40D.description:
Identify a single syllable spoken
word with the same onset
(beginning sound) as a familiar word.

90BF9502417B457A91846DEAFA5F61E7.description:
With guidance and support, match
orally presented segmented
phonemes (e.g., C-A-T) to pictures
or words illustrating the
corresponding word.

90294EB49471476886A0FA541755E5A0.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes).

CA5D1B2EAAB84ED5B83B99EFD981613D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the
organization and basic features of
print (e.g., left-to-right, top-to-bottom orientation of print, one-to-one correspondence between
written and spoken word).

0B51EBA8328A406E8C37E20547DEB510.description:
Demonstrate emerging
understanding of the organization of print.
